page.title: 05Langton Field Farm - Appleby
page.content: At Langton Field there are sheep, cattle and horses.Fields are under barley and grass for hay and silage. Crops are not grown for sale but for animal feed.Milk goes to the Dairy to be made into butter and cheese. My dad,John Horn,works on the farm he is the tractor man.The owner,Mr Bell looks after the sheep and the cows.The owner's father looks after the horses.David wilkinson looks after the calves and feeds them.Eric Fleming milks the cows twice a day.In the morning he milks them from 6:00 till 8:30 and at night from 4:00 till 6:00 In summer the cows go out in the field.In the winter they go in the shed and they have silage to eat.When it is lambing season we fetch all the sheep near the farm so they are easier to get in when they are ready to lamb. Mr.Bell also has race horses.
